attributes.action: Address the public transport's '30 people system limit.'
attributes.additional_details: I would like the Government to fix this matter or at least address it because if the bus drivers don't follow the rule why even bother adding a system like that? This could be a threatening matter to people who are vulnerable and don't want others sitting next to them, which then increases the risk. I believe the Government should take every matter possible to reduce the risk of transmission and if that includes making sure bus drivers follow the rules, then so be it. I also want the Government to fix this issue so that the community can feel safe again and don't worry everytime a member of the community enters a bus.
attributes.background: I would like the government to address and maybe even fix the Public Transport's system of 30 people at a time. This is because it increases the risk of the Coronavirus as people will start sitting next to each other and getting too close to each other when standing up.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to request a clear action for which the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

We understand you're concerned about ensuring a safe maximum passenger number for public transport during the COVID-19 pandemic, but we're not sure what action you want the Government or transport authorities to take in response. 

You could start a petition calling for the Government to review its guidance to transport providers on safe passenger limits, if that's what you'd like to see happen.
